text: are you someone who is quick to order
chocolate mousse at a restaurant but
hesitates to make it at home
well chocolate mousse is a lot easier to
make than you may think what do you need
for chocolate mousse well you need
chocolate of course and I'm using four
ounces of semi-sweet chocolate and I'm
going to melt this over a pot of
simmering water with four tablespoons of
butter you want to make sure that your
waters not boiling because you don't
want to burn your chocolate this recipe
is really fun because it's a recipe of
bohr's
four ounces of semi-sweet chocolate four
tablespoons of butter we're using four
eggs and a quarter of a cup of sugar now
there are a few other ingredients but
we'll get to those a little bit later
this just has to melt together it will
only take a few minutes and once that's
done we're ready to make the rest of the
mousse so the chocolate and butter it's
melted all together evenly combined and
I'm going to remove the bowl from heat
here and now add four egg yolks so I
have separated four large eggs and the
yolks go into the chocolate mixture and
then I have the four whites in my stand
mixer here and you want to make sure
that your whites come to room
temperature before we whip them up and
I'm going to just froth this together
with a little bit of cream of tartar so
that's kind of on a medium low speed
just a pinch of cream of tartar and
cream of tartar is acidic and what it
does is it helps to stabilize your with
egg whites so the egg whites are nice
and foamy they've increased in volume
slightly and now I'm going to gradually
add four tablespoons of granulated sugar
so you want to add it gradually so that
it gives the sugar a champ to dissolve
in the egg whites you don't get anything
that's gritty or granular
and sugar also hope to stabilize egg
whites and of course sugar and egg
whites together make a meringue so once
you finish adding the sugar here
increase in speed and you want to whip
the egg whites until you have nice v
weeks and your meringue is nice and
shiny the meringue is nice and white and
light and voluminous and you can see
that it's holding a nice stiff peak it's
not folding over too too much so my egg
whites are ready and now the last
ingredient you're going to need is a
half a cup which is 4 ounces again going
with the fours of heavy cream
that is chilled and in a chilled bowl
and we need to now whip this up as well
chocolate mousse the term mousse is it's
actually French and it means foam so
with your cream with the whisk until
it's nice and silken you don't want to
over whip it so I'm going to set this
off to the side so now I'm going to fold
in my egg whites and whenever you're
folding what you really want to do is
you want to take whatever is light and
airy you want to take a portion of that
and you want to add it to the base which
is this chocolate mixture and what this
does is it makes it easier than to
incorporate the rest of your egg whites
so use your whisk here you don't have to
be too gentle at this stage what you're
doing is you're lightening the base you
can whisk the egg whites into the
chocolate mixture and now I'm going to
fold in the rest of the egg whites in
two additional stages and folding again
is bringing the chocolate mixture up and
over the egg whites rotating the bowl
and the reason why you fold is because
you don't want to deflate the mixture so
this is gently incorporating the two
ingredients while saving all of that
wonderful air that's going to give you
that amazing texture to your mousse have
the remaining egg whites here and again
you don't have to fully incorporate it
just yet you can have some streaks here
because now we're going to add in the
whipped cream one great thing about this
recipe is that you
customize it and you can flavor it in so
many different ways you could add a
little bit of coffee extract or a
flavored liqueur like a hazelnut liqueur
would be really great in here there are
no streaks of egg white or cream left
and now to portion out the chocolate
mousse now you can do this in whatever
decorative bowls you have I like to use
an ice cream scoop because I think it
helps to portion out the mousse nice and
evenly now this recipe
it makes for generous servings but you
could certainly serve a smaller portion
and you could probably get 6 or even 8
of these servings put them right into
the refrigerator to chill and set up for
about an hour and then you will be ready
to serve the most decadent yet airy
dessert so it's been an hour the mousse
has set up nicely in the refrigerator
and now I can't wait to taste look at
how light into airy this is so decadent
and delicious and there you go
it's a restaurant-quality dessert that
you can make at home any night of the
week guys enjoy
you
